title.rendered: What is the cost of website development in India?

content.rendered:
A website is no longer a luxury in today’s digital age; it is a necessity. Having a properly working and secure website strengthens your visibility in the market, regardless of the size of your business.

The cost of website development is a variable component that is affected by a variety of factors, including the development approach, platform and language, design complexity, the goal of the site, features, and functionalities, and the amount of time it takes.

It’s very hard to estimate the correct cost of developing a website just by looking at it. Since a lot happens behind the scenes, and it all adds to the value of a website.

A professional website development organization may provide you with an estimate based on an in-depth review of your site’s requirements, functionality, and goals.

However, determining the cost of website development is difficult since it is dependent on many factors. Some of them are explained below:

  • Domain: 

A domain name is a name that is used to represent one or more IP addresses, such as a computer that is connected to the internet. The first step in website development is obtaining a domain name. Domain websites such as GoDaddy, BlueHost, Google, and others can help you get one for your business.

Certain websites additionally provide you with a dashboard for configuring DNS, hosting, and databases, among other things. So, decide what services/features you want from a domain provider and go from there. A domain will usually cost you around INR 900-1200 per year.

  • Hosting

You’ll need a web server to host your website, which will cost you money on a monthly or annual basis. This will be determined by the service you have chosen. Furthermore, the cost of developing a website is influenced by factors such as shared or dedicated hosting space, any special rates offered by the provider, and so on.

A shared hosting environment will cost you something between INR 5000 and 10,000/- per year; hosting it on a VPS will cost you around INR 40,000 and 100,000 per year depending on the configuration and server platform; and a dedicated server will cost you somewhere around INR 150,000 and 400,000 per year.

  • Design

The price of this service varies depending on the type of website design chosen. While there are a few free preset designs accessible, they come with a lot of hidden restrictions, which are not suitable for major enterprises because they are beginner designs.

Choosing a professional design is, therefore, a wise decision. Outsourcing this job to a web designer, sharing your requirements, and having it produced within predetermined dates is the ideal method to achieve a unique design for your website.

A nice professional design can cost somewhere between INR 10,000 and 60,000, while an exclusive professional design can cost around INR 100,000 and 300,000, and occasionally more.

  • Content

The success of a website is determined in large part by its content. As a result, it’s necessary to deliver the proper material to the website within the specified time frame. Images, documents, write-ups, videos, and other resources may be included in this content.

The cost of creating this content, which is available in a variety of formats is determined by the type of business you run, the intricacy of your services, and other factors.

SEO and digital marketing may also have an impact on the total cost of website creation. A page of copyrighted content will set you back around INR 3000.

  • Content Management System

Uploading and updating content on a website requires a good Content Management System. While there are other free CMS solutions available, such as WordPress, Joomla, Drupal, and others, these may not always match the requirements.

If you have particular needs and want to engage your customers more effectively, web developers can create a customized CMS for you. However, customizing a CMS would set you back anywhere between INR 100,000 and 500,000.

  • Search Engine Optimisation 

One of the most significant components in helping your website rank on a SERP for a certain set of keywords is SEO. When someone looks for a company like yours, optimizing your website for search engines means it will appear higher in search results.

Most SEO solutions include either on-page or off-page SEO, or a combination of the two. Depending on the services given, SEO might cost a company anything from INR 20,000 to INR 45,000 each year. Furthermore, SEO results for any organization would take at least six months to emerge.

  • Social Media Setup

What social media setup entails is creating a business page on various social media platforms and regularly updating it with important business information. Because social networking sites have greater priority when they affirm the website as accurate, setting up these accounts can help you boost your online presence and ranking in search results.

You can save money by having things done in-house. On the other side, outsourcing can cost anything between INR 5000 and 20,000 per year.

  • Setting Up an Email Newsletter

Businesses are increasingly relying on newsletters to promote and advertise themselves. These can also be used to provide anonymous users, subscribers, or customer company updates or to build a community.

You must have a newsletter application service linked to your website to use this service. Depending on the type of newsletter you intend to publish, the cost of integrating a newsletter application service into your website varies.

  • Responsive Web Pages

A dynamic website has become a crucial tool for enhancing the user experience across all platforms and screen sizes.

It’s critical to make your website responsive because Google uses this characteristic, as well as mobile page performance, as a ranking factor.

Because such a website necessitates a lot more CSS and the use of frameworks like bootstrap and flex, the cost is likely to be higher than for other websites. If a website has 5-10 pages, for example, the additional price per site can range from INR 3,000 to 5000.

  • Well-Organized Navigation Structure 

For visitors to understand where they can access certain information, a clear navigation structure is required.

It also increases the expense of website development. A dynamic retractable menu, for example, costs more but is less expensive than a menu or navigation design with images and icons.

Depending on the simplicity and complexity of the navigation menu, the additional cost due to the navigation structure can range between INR 5,000 and 50,000.

  • Site Searches

This can be used to enhance a website’s navigating capabilities. Including this feature would undoubtedly incur additional costs. The cost of developing a website will skyrocket if you wish to include an advanced search function.

Depending on the sort of search capabilities you implement, this fee can range from INR 10,000 to 30,000 per website.

  • Price of an eCommerce Extension

An eCommerce addition is likewise not inexpensive and will set you back a significant sum of money. It will also increase the job of the website developer, as he or she will be required to create a product catalog for the company as well as implement a shopping cart feature.

Integration of a payment gateway would also be required. All of this adds up to an additional cost of INR 10,000 to 60,000, not to mention the time it takes to put up the website.

Conclusion

Although it is feasible to create a website at a low price, this is not a good idea. A website devoid of essential features and functionality is a waste of time, money, and effort. As a result, it is preferable to create a website with all of the elements necessary to get the desired outcomes and money. 

Ensure that your website is up to date with the latest features and innovations that the industry releases regularly. This will not only assist you in keeping your customers pleased, but it will also assist you in increasing your market visibility and staying ahead of your competitors.
